Commands mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project. mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server. mkdocs build - Build the documentation site. mkdocs help - Print this help message. docs.title: images

docs.text: XXX Project Hiroki Masumoto h.masumoto@tsukazaki-eye.net What is XXX project? We published 13047 images of 5389 people, 8588 eyes, which were taken between October 11, 2011 and September 6, 2018, 2011 at Tsukazaki Hospital, with Optos (200Tx), which was the main device of our development and research. Tsukazaki Hospital is the largest ophthalmology facility in Japan. Over 15 years, I have built a database from 1 million or more images of 100,000 or more IDs. In addition, we have made a variety of papers up until now based on the data taken in our daily practice. In fact, we are a top planner in AI development in the Japanese ophthalmology industry. It is hoped that publishing this data set will not only advance ophthalmology AI research but also help to educate ophthalmology and AI human resources. Why is the Optos images dataset? We place great importance on national health insurance system in Japan. This system, which can ensure the right to medical treatment for rich and poor people equally, is a very important system for medical treatment to function as an infrastructure in Japan. On the other hand, it is clear that as the declining birthrate and the aging population progress, the system will not stand. Therefore, there are only three methods left to address the declining birthrate and aging population: (1) increasing efficiency of medical practice by IT, (2) medical inbound (3) innovation in Japan in our opinion. We have published papers using ultra wide-field fundus images taken with the Optos of Nikon in Japan. This is very meaningful in terms of enhancing the presence of the Japanese company's product in the world. Our paper of rhegmatogenous retinal detachment (RRD) diagnosis using Neural Network has been taken up by the American Academy of Ophthalmology. RRD is the 1st cause of litigation-related disease in Ophthalmology in the United States, and is a very important disease in developed countries. Lesions of RRD can only be taken with Optos. A content of this dataset. img folder・・・・the folder contains the images data.csv・・・・・the csv contains the columns of filename (filename), sex, left or right(LR) and tags of disease The tags of disease include age-related macular degeneration (AMD), retinal vein occlusion (RVO), glaucoma (Gla), macular hole (MH), diabetic retinopathy (DR), retinal detachment (RD), retinitis pigmentosa (RP), retinal artery occlusion (AO), diabetes mellitus (DM). If the tags of the AMD, RVO, Gla, MH, DR, RD, RP, AO, DM are 0, it means the eye don’t have fundus disease (Normal eye). The DM tag are labeled only on HbA1c of Blood test. age： 65.1±12.9 years old Normal images: 4894 The amounts of each disease are as follows. Disease Amount AMD 413 RVO 778 Gla 2619 MH 222 DR 3323 RD 974 RP 258 AO 21 DM 3895 Download Please download the data set from the following URL. https://www.dropbox.com/sh/6shxxshmociacme/AACTky2oJFu7eqN1V-_Wdwaqa?dl=0 Data included in this database can be used, free of charge, only for research and educational purposes. Copy, redistribution, and any unauthorized commercial use are prohibited. Any researcher reporting results that use this database must acknowledge the XXX program by adding the following information: Kindly provided by the XXX program partners (see http://XXX ) In addition, we appreciate to hear about any publication that is based on the XXX database. Feedback on the database and this website is also welcome. The person to contact is Hiroki Masumoto. We also have the undisclosed tags of these images. If you would like to use these tags, please contact us. Acknowledgements We thank the following people for confirmation the tags. Masahiro Kameoka, Daisuke Nagasato, Ryota Aoki, Takahiro Sogawa, Hirotaka Tanabe, Toshihiko Nagasawa, Yuki Yoshizumi. I also would like to thank all staffs of Tsukazaki Hospital. Published paper about Optos with neural network Accuracy of deep learning, a machine-learning technology, using ultra–wide-field fundus ophthalmoscopy for detecting rhegmatogenous retinal detachment Ohsugi H, Tabuchi H, Enno H, Ishitobi N Scientific Reports 2017 Aug 25;7(1):9425. doi: 10.1038/s41598-017-09891-x. Accuracy of ultra–wide-field fundus ophthalmoscopy-assisted deep learning, a machine-learning technology, for detecting age related macular degeneration Matsuba S, Tabuchi H, Ohsugi H, Enno H, Ishitobi N, Masumoto H, Kiuchi Y International Ophthalmology. 2018 May 9. doi: 10.1007/s10792-018-0940-0. Deep-learning classifier with an ultrawide-field scanning laser ophthalmoscope detects glaucoma visual field severity Masumoto H, Tabuchi H, Nakakura S, Ishitobi N, Miki M, Enno H Journal of Glaucoma. 2018 Jul;27(7):647-652. doi: 10.1097/IJG.0000000000000988. Accuracy of Deep Learning, a Machine-Learning Technology, Using Ultra–Widefield Fundus Ophthalmoscopy for Detecting Idiopathic Macular Holes Nagasawa T, Tabuchi H, Masumoto H, Enno H, Niki M, Ohsugi H, Mitamura Y PeerJ. 2018 Oct 22;6:e5696. doi: 10.7717/peerj.5696. eCollection 2018. Deep neural network-based method for detecting central retinal vein occlusion using ultrawide-field fundus ophthalmoscopy Nagasato D, Tabuchi H, Ohsugi H, Masumoto H, Enno H, Ishitobi N, Sonobe T, Kameoka M, Niki M, Hayashi K, Mitamura Y Journal of Ophthalmology 2018 Nov 1;2018:1875431. doi: 10.1155/2018/1875431. eCollection 2018 Discrimination ability of glaucoma via DCNNs models from ultra-wide angle fundus images comparing either full or confined to the optic disc Tabuchi H, Masumoto H, Nakakura S, Noguchi A, Tanabe H Computer Vision – ACCV 2018 Workshops P229-234 doi:10.1007/978-3-030-21074-8_18 Retinal Detachment Screening with Ensembles of Neural Network Models Masumoto H, Tabuchi H, Adachi S, Nakakura S, Ohsugi H, Nagasato D Computer Vision – ACCV 2018 Workshops P251-260 doi:10.1007/978-3-030-21074-8_20 Deep-learning classifier with ultrawide-field fundus ophthalmoscopy for detecting branch retinal vein occlusion Nagasato D, Tabuchi H, Ohsugi H, Masumoto H, Enno H, Ishitobi N, Sonobe T, Kameoka M, Niki M, Mitamura Y International Journal of Ophthalmology. 2019 Jan 18;12(1):94-99. doi: 10.18240/ijo.2019.01.15. eCollection 2019 Accuracy of ultrawide-field fundus ophthalmoscopy-assisted deep learning for detecting treatment-naïve proliferative diabetic retinopathy Nagasawa T, Tabuchi H, Masumoto H, Enno H, Niki M, Ohara Z, Yoshizumi Y, Ohsugi H, Mitamura Y International Ophthalmology 2019 Feb. doi: 10.1007/s10792-019-01074-z Accuracy of a deep convolutional neural network in detection of retinitis pigmentosa on ultrawide-field images Masumoto H, Tabuchi H, Nakakura S, Ohsugi H, Enno H, Ishitobi N, Ohsugi E, Mitamura Y PeerJ. 2019 May 7;7:e6900. doi: 10.7717/peerj.6900. eCollection 2019
